location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 38 1833 from David Anderson Blane, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire, to Charles Norris, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the commencement of hostilities against Katif [Al-Qaṭīf] by Ubdulla ben Ahmed [Shaikh ‘Abdullāh bin Aḥmad Āl Khalīfah], Chief of Bahrein [Bahrain], and his intention to oppose the extension of Wahabee [Wahhabi] authority. It also notes the Resident's opinion that the rise of Wahabee power could be beneficial to the suppression of piracy, but the British connection to the Imam of Muscat, Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, is a potential source of difficultly.
